| image = BrickCapitol.jpg imagename = Brick Capitol, later used as a Civil War
| prison imagedate= about 1861
}} The 'Fifteenth United States Congress' was a meeting of the legislative
branch of the United States federal government, consisting of the United States
Senate and the United States House of Representatives. It met in the Old Brick
Capitol in Washington, D.C. from March 4, 1817 to March 4, 1819, during the
first two years of James Monroe's presidency. The apportionment of seats in the
House of Representatives was based on the Third Census of the United States in
1810. Both chambers had a Democratic-Republican majority.
